description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Special Education provides services for over 6000 Oakland students with special needs. This includes training teachers, providing resources to families, and implementing Individualized Education Plans (IEPs) for each special education student. There are ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{"uri":"https://www.understood.org/en/school-learning/special-services/special-education-basics/conditions-covered-under-idea"},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"value":"13 categories of disabilities","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"hyperlink"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" which qualify students for special education support. Beyond teacher training, Oakland offers a spectrum of services including resources specialists who support special education students within general education classes and at special times during the day, special all-day classes for students with moderate or severe disabilities, and home or hospital instruction.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
